storyTitle: As Operations Manager, I want to generate schedule reports filtered by date and team to achieve optimized resource allocation

testCases.title: Generate schedule report with valid filters
preconditions: User is logged in with Operations Manager role
User has authorization to access schedule reporting module
Schedule database contains test data for multiple teams and date ranges
At least one scheduling conflict exists in the test data

steps.action: Navigate to schedule reporting module from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule report UI is displayed with filter options including date range picker, team dropdown, and generate report button

steps.action: Select a valid start date from the date range picker
steps.expectedResult: Start date is populated in the date range field without validation errors

steps.action: Select a valid end date that is after the start date
steps.expectedResult: End date is populated in the date range field and date range is validated successfully

steps.action: Select one or more teams from the team filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected teams are displayed in the filter section and filters are accepted without errors

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button to submit the report generation request
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and displays a loading indicator

steps.action: Wait for report generation to complete
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated within 5 seconds displaying schedule data for the selected date range and teams

steps.action: Review the generated report content for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: Report displays accurate schedule information including team members, dates, activities, and any scheduling conflicts are clearly highlighted with visual indicators

postconditions: Schedule report is displayed on screen with accurate data
Scheduling conflicts are visibly highlighted in the report
Report generation time is logged and within 5 seconds
User remains on the report viewing page

testCases.title: Export schedule report to PDF and Excel
preconditions: User is logged in with Operations Manager role
User has authorization to export reports
Schedule report has been successfully generated and is displayed on screen
Browser allows file downloads
PDF and Excel export functionality is enabled

steps.action: Generate schedule report with valid date range and team filters
steps.expectedResult: Report is successfully generated and displayed on screen with complete schedule data

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Export to PDF' button in the report toolbar
steps.expectedResult: System initiates PDF export process and displays export progress indicator

steps.action: Wait for PDF export to complete
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is generated and automatically downloads to the default download location with filename format 'Schedule_Report_[date].pdf'

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using a PDF reader
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens successfully displaying the report with correct layout, formatting, data integrity maintained, and conflicts highlighted

steps.action: Return to the schedule report page in the application
steps.expectedResult: Report is still displayed on screen with all data intact

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Export to Excel' button in the report toolbar
steps.expectedResult: System initiates Excel export process and displays export progress indicator

steps.action: Wait for Excel export to complete
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is generated and automatically downloads to the default download location with filename format 'Schedule_Report_[date].xlsx'

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file using spreadsheet software
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens successfully with correct data structure, all columns properly formatted, data matches the original report, and no data loss occurred

postconditions: Two files are downloaded: one PDF and one Excel file
Both exported files contain accurate and complete report data
Original report remains displayed in the application
Export actions are logged in the system audit trail

testCases.title: Schedule automated report generation and email delivery
preconditions: User is logged in with Operations Manager role
User has authorization to schedule automated reports
Email service is configured and operational
Valid recipient email addresses are available
Schedule report module is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule reporting module and click on 'Schedule Automated Reports' option
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling UI is displayed showing options for report frequency, date range, team filters, format selection, and recipient email fields

steps.action: Select report frequency (daily, weekly, or monthly) from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Frequency is selected and additional time/day options are displayed based on selection

steps.action: Set the specific time for report generation
steps.expectedResult: Time is accepted and displayed in the scheduling configuration

steps.action: Configure date range parameters for the automated report (e.g., last 7 days, current week)
steps.expectedResult: Date range parameters are accepted and validated successfully

steps.action: Select team filters to be applied to the automated report
steps.expectedResult: Team filters are selected and displayed in the configuration

steps.action: Enter valid recipient email addresses in the email field (comma-separated for multiple recipients)
steps.expectedResult: Email addresses are validated and accepted without errors

steps.action: Select export format for the automated report (PDF, Excel, or both)
steps.expectedResult: Format selection is accepted and displayed in the configuration summary

steps.action: Click 'Save Schedule' button to save the automated report configuration
steps.expectedResult: Configuration is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and scheduled report appears in the list of active schedules

steps.action: Wait for the scheduled time to arrive or trigger a test execution of the scheduled report
steps.expectedResult: System automatically generates the report at the scheduled time with the configured parameters

steps.action: Check the recipient email inbox at the scheduled delivery time
steps.expectedResult: Email is received with subject line containing report name and date, email body contains report summary, and correct report file(s) are attached in the specified format(s)

steps.action: Download and open the attached report file(s) from the email
steps.expectedResult: Attached files open successfully with accurate report data matching the configured filters and parameters

postconditions: Automated report schedule is saved and active in the system
Scheduled report appears in the list of active automated reports
Email with correct report attachment is successfully delivered to all recipients
Report generation and email delivery are logged in the system
Schedule remains active for future executions unless disabled

storyTitle: As Operations Manager, I want to export schedule reports in multiple formats to facilitate sharing and analysis

testCases.title: Export schedule report to PDF
preconditions: User is logged in with Operations Manager role
User has authorization to export reports
Schedule report has been generated with valid filters
Report contains data to be exported
Browser allows file downloads
PDF export functionality is enabled in the system

steps.action: Navigate to schedule reporting module and generate a schedule report with selected date range and team filters
steps.expectedResult: Schedule report is successfully generated and displayed on screen with complete data including headers, schedule details, and any conflicts

steps.action: Verify the report content is accurate and complete before exporting
steps.expectedResult: Report displays all expected data fields, formatting is correct, and data matches the applied filters

steps.action: Locate the export options toolbar and click on 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: System initiates PDF export process, displays processing indicator, and export request is submitted to the server

steps.action: Monitor the export processing time
steps.expectedResult: Export is processed within 10 seconds and PDF file download begins automatically

steps.action: Check the browser's download location for the exported PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is successfully downloaded with appropriate filename (e.g., Schedule_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.pdf) and file size is reasonable

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using a PDF reader application
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens without errors and is not corrupted

steps.action: Verify the PDF content matches the original report displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: All report data is correctly rendered in the PDF including headers, schedule entries, team information, dates, and conflict highlights

steps.action: Check the PDF layout and formatting quality
steps.expectedResult: Layout is preserved with proper page breaks, fonts are readable, tables are properly formatted, and visual elements like conflict highlights are clearly visible

steps.action: Verify PDF metadata and properties
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains appropriate metadata including creation date, title, and is not password protected unless required

postconditions: PDF file is successfully downloaded to local system
PDF contains accurate and complete report data
Original report remains displayed in the application
Export action is logged in system audit trail with timestamp and user information
PDF file can be shared and opened on other systems

testCases.title: Export schedule report to Excel
preconditions: User is logged in with Operations Manager role
User has authorization to export reports
Schedule report has been generated with valid filters
Report contains data to be exported
Browser allows file downloads
Excel export functionality is enabled in the system
Excel-compatible software is available to open the file

steps.action: Navigate to schedule reporting module and generate a schedule report with selected date range and team filters
steps.expectedResult: Schedule report is successfully generated and displayed on screen with complete tabular data

steps.action: Review the report to ensure all data columns and rows are present
steps.expectedResult: Report displays all expected columns (e.g., Date, Team, Employee, Activity, Time) and data rows match the filter criteria

steps.action: Locate the export options toolbar and click on 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: System initiates Excel export process, displays processing indicator, and export request is submitted to the server

steps.action: Monitor the export processing time
steps.expectedResult: Export is processed within 10 seconds and Excel file download begins automatically

steps.action: Check the browser's download location for the exported Excel file
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is successfully downloaded with appropriate filename (e.g., Schedule_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.xlsx) in XLSX format

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file using spreadsheet software (Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, or LibreOffice Calc)
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens without errors, no corruption warnings are displayed, and file structure is intact

steps.action: Verify the Excel file contains all data from the original report
steps.expectedResult: All rows and columns from the report are present in the Excel file with no data loss or truncation

steps.action: Check the data structure and formatting in the Excel file
steps.expectedResult: Data is correctly structured with proper column headers in the first row, data types are preserved (dates as dates, numbers as numbers), and cells are properly formatted

steps.action: Verify special elements like scheduling conflicts are represented in the Excel file
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are indicated through cell formatting (e.g., highlighting, color coding) or additional columns, making them easily identifiable

steps.action: Test data manipulation capabilities in the Excel file
steps.expectedResult: Data can be sorted, filtered, and analyzed using standard Excel functions without errors

postconditions: Excel file is successfully downloaded to local system
Excel file contains accurate and complete report data with correct structure
Data types and formatting are preserved appropriately
Original report remains displayed in the application
Export action is logged in system audit trail with timestamp and user information
Excel file can be shared, edited, and analyzed using spreadsheet software

storyTitle: As Operations Manager, I want to filter schedule reports by project to focus on relevant activities

testCases.title: Filter schedule report by project
preconditions: User is logged in as Operations Manager with valid credentials
User has authorization to access schedule reporting module
At least one project exists in the system with associated schedule data
Scheduling database contains schedule entries for multiple projects
User has network connectivity to access the system

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule reporting module from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule reporting module is displayed with all available filter options and an empty or default report view

steps.action: Click on the project filter dropdown and select a specific project from the list
steps.expectedResult: Selected project is displayed in the project filter field and filter is marked as active

steps.action: Optionally select additional filters such as date range and team filters
steps.expectedResult: All selected filters are displayed as active and accepted by the system

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' or 'Apply Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and displays a loading indicator

steps.action: Wait for report generation to complete
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated within 5 seconds and displays schedule data filtered by the selected project, showing only activities and schedules associated with that project

steps.action: Review the filtered report data for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All displayed schedule entries belong to the selected project and no entries from other projects are shown

postconditions: Schedule report displays only data for the selected project
Filter selections remain active in the UI
Report is available for export if needed
System logs the report generation activity
User session maintains the current filter state

testCases.title: Persist filter selections during session
preconditions: User is logged in as Operations Manager with valid credentials
User has authorization to access schedule reporting module
Schedule reporting module is accessible
Multiple projects and teams exist in the system for filter selection
User session is active and valid

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule reporting module
steps.expectedResult: Schedule reporting module is displayed with default or empty filter settings

steps.action: Select a specific project from the project filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected project is displayed in the project filter field

steps.action: Select a date range filter by choosing start and end dates
steps.expectedResult: Selected date range is displayed in the date filter field

steps.action: Select a team from the team filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected team is displayed in the team filter field

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' or 'Apply Filters' button to apply all filters
steps.expectedResult: Filtered report is generated and displayed showing schedule data matching all applied filters (project, date range, and team)

steps.action: Navigate away from the schedule reporting module to another section of the application (e.g., dashboard, settings, or another module)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully navigates to the different section and the new page is displayed

steps.action: Navigate back to the schedule reporting module using the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule reporting module is displayed again

steps.action: Verify the filter selections in the project, date, and team filter fields
steps.expectedResult: All previously selected filters (project, date range, and team) are retained and displayed exactly as they were before navigating away

steps.action: Verify the report data displayed
steps.expectedResult: The filtered report automatically displays the same filtered schedule data without requiring the user to regenerate the report

postconditions: Filter selections persist throughout the user session
Report data remains consistent with the persisted filters
User can continue working with the same filter context
Session state is maintained in the system
No data loss occurs during navigation
